page.title: 19TRANSPORT
page.content: The survey area has many small isolated communities and many narrow roads and country lanes linking them.The main line railway passes through the area,but there are no stations actually in our square.The bus services provided by Western National and the independent Grenville Bus Company tend to operate along the major routes,and in any case would be unable to negotiate many of the accesses to villages and farms. Therefore it would be true to say that a large proportion of the survey area is without any effective form of public transport within a reasonable distance. In the more remote parts of the area therefore a car would appear to be a neccesity if any travelling at all is to be undertaken. This is a common problem in rural areas and is made worse by a lack of amenities.
